content.question: Which of the following claims in the first and second paragraph of the excerpt did Las Casas use to support his overall argument about the capabilities of Native Americans?

choices.label: Spain’s behavior toward Native Americans could be called “barbarian.”
Native American societies did not meet the definition of “barbarian.”
Spain’s European rivals were more like “barbarians” than Native Americans were.
Native Americans believed that the Spanish were “barbarians.”

content.answer: Native American societies did not meet the definition of “barbarian.”

topic.text: 1.6: Cultural Interactions Between Europeans, Native Americans, and Africans

skill.text: Skill 3.B: Identify the evidence used in a source to support an argument.
